009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.ImageStack;
014import ij.WindowManager;
015import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
016import ij.gui.NewImage;
017import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
018import ij.process.Blitter;
019import ij.process.ByteBlitter;
020import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
021import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
022
023/**
024 * This imageJ plugin demonstrates blending of two images
025 * and generating a stack of intermediate images.
026 * At least two images must be open. The active image is 
027 * taken as the first image, the second image may be selected
028 * interactively.
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 *
032 */
033public class Alpha_Blending_Stack implements PlugInFilter {
034        static int nFrames = 10;
035
036        ImagePlus fgIm = null; // foreground image (chosen interactively)
037        
038        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
039                return DOES_8G;
040        }
041
042        public void run(ImageProcessor bgIp) {
043                if (!runDialog() || fgIm == null) {
044                        return;
045                }
046                
047                int w = bgIp.getWidth();
048                int h = bgIp.getHeight();
049
050                // prepare foreground image
051                ImageProcessor fgIp = fgIm.getProcessor().convertToByte(false);
052                ImageProcessor fgTmpIp = bgIp.duplicate();
053
054                // create image stack
055                ImagePlus movie = NewImage.createByteImage("Movie", w, h, nFrames, 0); 
056                ImageStack stack = movie.getStack();
057
058                // loop over stack frames
059                for (int i = 0; i < nFrames; i++) {
060                        // transparency of foreground image
061                        double iAlpha = 1.0 - (double) i / (nFrames - 1);
062                        ImageProcessor iFrame = stack.getProcessor(i + 1); 
063                        // copy background image to frame i
064                        iFrame.insert(bgIp, 0, 0);
065                        iFrame.multiply(iAlpha);
066
067                        // copy foreground image and make transparent
068                        fgTmpIp.insert(fgIp, 0, 0);
069                        fgTmpIp.multiply(1 - iAlpha);
070
071                        // add foreground image frame \Code{i}
072                        ByteBlitter blitter = new ByteBlitter((ByteProcessor) iFrame);
073                        blitter.copyBits(fgTmpIp, 0, 0, Blitter.ADD);
074                }
075
076                // display movie (image stack)
077                movie.show();
078        }
079        
080        private boolean runDialog() {
081                // get list of open images
082                // TODO: simplify foreground image selection (see matching plugins)
083                int[] windowList = WindowManager.getIDList(); 
084                if (windowList == null) {
085                        IJ.noImage();
086                        return false;
087                }
088                String[] windowTitles = new String[windowList.length];
089                for (int i = 0; i < windowList.length; i++) {
090                        ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(windowList[i]); 
091                        if (imp != null)
092                                windowTitles[i] = imp.getShortTitle(); 
093                        else
094                                windowTitles[i] = "untitled";
095                }
096                
097                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Alpha Blending"); 
098                gd.addChoice("Foreground image:", 
099                windowTitles, windowTitles[0]);
100                gd.addNumericField("Frames:", nFrames, 0); 
101                
102                gd.showDialog(); 
103                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
104                        return false;
105                
106                int img2Index = gd.getNextChoiceIndex(); 
107                fgIm = WindowManager.getImage(windowList[img2Index]);
108                nFrames = (int) gd.getNextNumber(); 
109                if (nFrames < 2)
110                        nFrames = 2;
111                return true;
112        }
113
114}
